overview: 2 Chronicles covers Solomon's reign through the Babylonian exile, focusing on Judah's kings and the temple. It ends hopefully with Cyrus's decree allowing the exiles to return and rebuild.

verses.text: If my people who are called by my name humble themselves, and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven and will forgive their sin and heal their land.
For the eyes of the LORD run to and fro throughout the whole earth, to give strong support to those whose heart is blameless toward him.
Thus says the LORD to you, 'Do not be afraid and do not be dismayed at this great horde, for the battle is not yours but God's.'

passages.title: Solomon's Temple Dedication
passages.summary: God's glory fills the temple so powerfully the priests cannot stand to minister. God promises to hear prayers offered toward this place.

passages.title: Jehoshaphat's Victory
passages.summary: When surrounded by enemies, Judah fasts and prays. God tells them the battle is His, and they win by sending worshipers ahead of the army.

facts.text: 2 Chronicles 7:14 is one of the most quoted Old Testament verses about national repentance and spiritual revival.
The book evaluates each king primarily by their faithfulness to proper temple worship, not political success.
Chronicles ends with the same words that begin Ezra, suggesting they were originally one continuous work.
Even at the end, despite exile, there's hopeâ€”Cyrus decrees that God's temple should be rebuilt.

figures.name: Solomon
figures.description: Builder of the temple in all its glory. His dedication prayer shows deep understanding of God's nature and human need.

figures.name: Jehoshaphat
figures.description: A good king who sought God and won battles through worship, though his alliances with Israel's wicked kings brought trouble.

figures.name: Hezekiah
figures.description: Led one of Judah's greatest revivals, reopening and cleansing the temple and restoring Passover observance.

figures.name: Josiah
figures.description: Became king at age 8 and led sweeping reforms after rediscovering the Book of the Law in the neglected temple.

videos.title: 2 Chronicles Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project completes the Chronicles narrative, ending with hope for restoration.
